definition[0]: to decay by a gradual natural process, or to make something do this
example[1]: The trees were cut and left to rot.
example[2]: All the woodwork was rotting away.
definition[1]: the natural process of decaying, or the part of something that has decayed
example[4]: wood that is soft with rot
definition[2]: a state in which something becomes bad or does not work as well as it should
example[5]: He criticized the talk shows as ‘cultural rot’.
example[6]: The team has enough good players to stop the rot.
example[7]: It was after he left the company that the rot set in.
